content:
Diagnosis:	Gastric adenocarcinoma, T2N1M0

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Subtotal gastrectomy with D2 lymphadenectomy

Histology:	Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, T2N1(2/15)M0, R0 resection. HER2 negative, MSI stable.

Current Situation:	Post-operative assessment for adjuvant chemotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent subtotal gastrectomy. He has recovered well from surgery with no post-operative complications. His weight is stable at 72kg (pre-operative weight 75kg) and he is managing a soft diet with small frequent meals. Performance status is 1.

He has no significant comorbidities apart from well-controlled hypertension on ramipril. He lives with his wife and continues to be active, walking 30 minutes daily.

Given the presence of lymph node involvement and T2 disease, I have recommended adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy for 6 cycles. We discussed the aims of treatment and potential side effects including neuropathy, diarrhea, and fatigue. He understands to contact us if any concerns arise during treatment.

Baseline bloods today show satisfactory renal function and normal LFTs. I have prescribed cycle 1 CAPOX to commence next week. We will review him prior to cycle 2 in three weeks' time.

cancer_timeline.value: Subtotal gastrectomy with D2 lymphadenectomy, R0 resection
Pathology confirms T2N1(2/15)M0, moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, HER2 negative, MSI stable
Plan to commence adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy for 6 cycles

patient_facts.value: satisfactory renal function and normal LFTs

status_updates.value: Recently diagnosed gastric adenocarcinoma post successful R0 resection. Good recovery from surgery and suitable for adjuvant chemotherapy
Prescribed cycle 1 CAPOX to commence next week
Review prior to cycle 2 in three weeks
